answers.question: Which activities do you find most enjoyable in your free time?
answers.answer: Building or fixing things with my hands

answers.question: What type of content do you consume most online?
answers.answer: Technology and gadget reviews

answers.question: If you could master any skill instantly, which would you choose?
answers.answer: Programming or engineering

answers.question: What kind of problems do you enjoy solving?
answers.answer: Technical problems with clear solutions

answers.question: Which school subjects did you enjoy or excel at most?
answers.answer: Computer Science or Engineering

answers.question: What type of volunteer work appeals to you most?
answers.answer: Teaching technology skills to others

answers.question: How would you rate your analytical and logical thinking skills?
answers.answer: Excellent - I love breaking down complex problems

answers.question: How comfortable are you with technology and digital tools?
answers.answer: Very comfortable - I learn new tools quickly

answers.question: How would you describe your communication skills?
answers.answer: Good - I communicate clearly in most situations

answers.question: How creative do you consider yourself?
answers.answer: Creative - I enjoy creative problem-solving

answers.question: How well do you handle multiple tasks and deadlines?
answers.answer: Good - I manage my time well

answers.question: How would you rate your leadership abilities?
answers.answer: Good leader - I can lead when needed

answers.question: How do you prefer to recharge after a long day?
answers.answer: Spending time alone with my thoughts or hobbies

answers.question: When making decisions, do you rely more on:
answers.answer: Logic, facts, and objective analysis

answers.question: How do you handle unexpected changes or challenges?
answers.answer: I adapt quickly and see them as opportunities

answers.question: What motivates you most in your work?
answers.answer: Personal growth and learning new things

answers.question: How do you approach learning new things?
answers.answer: Learn best through hands-on experience

answers.question: How do you handle criticism or feedback?
answers.answer: Welcome it as an opportunity to improve

answers.question: What describes your risk-taking tendency?
answers.answer: I take risks when I have done my research

answers.question: What type of work environment do you prefer?
answers.answer: Fast-paced startup with lots of variety

answers.question: How do you prefer to collaborate with others?
answers.answer: Mix of solo and team work

answers.question: What is your ideal daily work routine?
answers.answer: Flexible schedule that I control

answers.question: How important is work-life balance to you?
answers.answer: Very important - But flexible when needed

answers.question: What type of tasks energize you the most?
answers.answer: Problem-solving and troubleshooting

answers.question: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?
answers.answer: Technical expert or specialist in my field

primaryCareerField.name: Software Engineering & Development
primaryCareerField.description: Based on your strong analytical skills, technology enthusiasm, hands-on learning preference, and enjoyment of problem-solving, software engineering is an ideal career path. Your logical thinking and adaptability to new technologies make you well-suited for this dynamic field.

topCareerFields.name: Software Engineering & Development
topCareerFields.reason: Your logical thinking, technology comfort, preference for building solutions, and hands-on learning style align perfectly with software development.

topCareerFields.name: Data Science & Analytics
topCareerFields.reason: Your analytical mindset, comfort with technical problems, and research-based risk-taking suit data-driven roles well.

topCareerFields.name: Product Management (Tech)
topCareerFields.reason: Your blend of technical understanding, communication skills, and leadership potential make tech product management a viable path.

strengths: Exceptional analytical thinking - You naturally deconstruct complex problems into manageable components, essential for debugging and system design
High technology adaptability - You quickly master new tools and platforms, keeping you relevant in the fast-evolving tech industry
Growth mindset - Your openness to feedback and continuous learning ensures long-term career development
Balanced collaboration style - You work effectively both independently and in teams, valuable in modern agile environments
areasToImprove: Public speaking confidence - Practice presenting technical concepts to diverse audiences to enhance your leadership potential
Networking skills - Actively engage in tech communities and professional events to expand career opportunities
Business acumen - Since your background is in Economics, leverage this by understanding the business impact of technical decisions

recommendedSkills.description: Master both frontend (React, Vue) and backend (Node.js, Python) to become a versatile developer. Start with one stack and expand.
Cloud computing is essential for modern applications. AWS certifications can significantly boost your employability.
Git is fundamental for all development work. Master branching strategies and collaboration workflows.
Understanding scalable architecture is crucial for senior roles. Study common patterns and practice designing systems.
Most tech companies use Scrum or Kanban. Understanding these improves team collaboration and project delivery.
Ability to document code and explain technical concepts clearly accelerates career growth.

suggestedJobRoles.title: Full-Stack Developer
suggestedJobRoles.description: Build complete web applications handling both user interface and server-side logic. Ideal for versatile problem-solvers.

suggestedJobRoles.title: Backend Developer
suggestedJobRoles.description: Focus on server-side logic, databases, and APIs. Perfect for those who enjoy deep technical challenges.

suggestedJobRoles.title: DevOps Engineer
suggestedJobRoles.description: Bridge development and operations through automation and infrastructure management.

suggestedJobRoles.title: Software Architect
suggestedJobRoles.description: Design high-level software structures and make key technical decisions. A natural progression for experienced developers.

month1.title: Foundation Building
tasks: Choose your primary tech stack (recommended: JavaScript/Node.js based on market demand)
Set up development environment (VS Code, Git, Node.js)
Complete a structured online course (freeCodeCamp, The Odin Project)
Build your first simple web application

month2.title: Core Skills Development
tasks: Deep dive into JavaScript fundamentals and ES6+ features
Learn a frontend framework (React recommended)
Understand RESTful API concepts
Practice with coding challenges (30 minutes daily)

month3.title: Backend & Database
tasks: Learn Node.js and Express.js
Master SQL and NoSQL databases (PostgreSQL, MongoDB)
Build a full-stack project with database integration
Start learning Git collaboration workflows

month4.title: Portfolio Projects
tasks: Build 2-3 portfolio projects demonstrating different skills
Deploy projects using Vercel, Railway, or AWS
Create a professional GitHub profile with good READMEs
Start your portfolio website

month5.title: Advanced Topics & Networking
tasks: Learn cloud basics (AWS Free Tier)
Study system design fundamentals
Join developer communities (Discord, local meetups)
Start technical blogging or content creation

month6.title: Job Preparation & Application
tasks: Prepare your resume highlighting projects and skills
Practice technical interview questions
Apply to positions (aim for 10+ applications weekly)
Conduct informational interviews with professionals

analysis.motivationalMessage: Əli, your journey from Economics to Software Engineering is not just possible—it's increasingly common and highly valued! Your analytical background gives you unique problem-solving abilities that many developers lack. The tech industry values diverse perspectives and your economic understanding can help you build products that make real business impact. Remember, many successful developers are self-taught, and your willingness to learn hands-on is exactly what this field rewards. Stay curious, build consistently, and don't be discouraged by bugs—every error is a learning opportunity. Your future in tech is bright, and Azerbaijan's growing tech sector needs passionate developers like you!

selectedFieldComparison.comparison: Your selection of Programming (Proqramlaşdırma) is an excellent match with your test results. Your answers consistently show traits that successful programmers share: logical thinking, technology comfort, problem-solving enjoyment, and hands-on learning preference. Your Economics background is actually an advantage—FinTech and business software companies highly value developers who understand both technology and business.
selectedFieldComparison.recommendation: Your instinct is spot-on! Programming is the right choice for you. Given your profile, I recommend starting with web development as it offers the fastest path to employability and allows you to see tangible results quickly, which aligns with your hands-on learning style. As you grow, you can specialize in areas like backend systems, cloud architecture, or even explore the intersection of finance and technology.
